sources.title: "The Sea Hawk" (1924)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     "The Sea Hawk" is a drama, adventure and a swashbuckler created by the Oscar-winning director Frank Lloyd starring Milton Sills, Enid Bennett, Lloyd Hughes, Wallace Beery, Marc McDermott, Wallace MacDonald, Bert Woodruff, Frank Currier, Lionel Belmore and many others. The film is based on the classic novel by Rafael Sabatini. ncis McDonald, Albert Prisco, Ralph Cloninger, Renée Adorée   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: The adventures of Oliver Tressilian, who goes from English gentry to galley slave to captain of a Moorish fighting ship, all the while trying to regain his lady love. Follows the novel, unlike the 1940 movie of the same name.
metadata.Writer: Rafael Sabatini, J.G. Hawks, Walter Anthony
metadata.Actors: Milton Sills, Enid Bennett, Lloyd Hughes
